intro: Nierembergia ericoides var. tandilensis, commonly known as the Tandil bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of showy blooms during the spring and early summer. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
